summary: The 'Research for Healthy Soils Act' amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to prioritize research on the impact of microplastics and per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) on farmland. The bill directs research and extension grants for analyzing the concentration, impacts, and remediation of these substances in land-applied biosolids and their effects on crops and soil health. It also extends the authorization for high-priority research and extension initiatives until 2031.
